SEARCH
Package org.deepdrimz.drimzsport.notification.sdk.client

Class NotificationServiceClient

java.lang.Object
org.deepdrimz.drimzsport.notification.sdk.client.NotificationServiceClient
public class NotificationServiceClient extends Object
Notification Service Client with Multi-Email Account Support.

This client provides core notification operations with intelligent email routing:

  • Send single notifications (Email, SMS, Push)
  • Send bulk notifications
  • Device token management for push notifications
  • Check notification status
  • Multi-email account support (marketing, support, notifications)

Quick Start:


 // Create client
 NotificationServiceClient client = NotificationServiceClient.builder()
     .baseUrl("https://api.drimzsport.com")
     .apiKey("your-api-key")
     .build();

 // Send marketing email (automatically uses marketing@drimzsport.com)
 NotificationResponse response = client.sendMarketingEmail(
     "user@example.com",
     "Special Offer!",
     "promo-template",
     Map.of("discount", "50%")
 );

 // Send support email (automatically uses support@drimzsport.com - replyable)
 client.sendSupportEmail(
     "user@example.com",
     "Ticket Created",
     "support-ticket-template",
     Map.of("ticketId", "12345")
 );
Since:
1.0.0
Version:
1.2.0
Author:
DrimzSport Team

    • registerDevice

      public DeviceTokenResponse registerDevice(String userId, String token, PlatformType platform, String deviceId)
      Registers a device token for push notifications.
      Parameters:
      userId - user identifier
      token - device token from FCM or APNS
      platform - platform type (ANDROID, IOS, WEB)
      deviceId - unique device identifier
      Returns:
      device token response with registration details

    • registerDevice

      public DeviceTokenResponse registerDevice(String userId, String token, PlatformType platform, String deviceId, String appVersion)
      Registers a device token for push notifications with app version.
      Parameters:
      userId - user identifier
      token - device token from FCM or APNS
      platform - platform type (ANDROID, IOS, WEB)
      deviceId - unique device identifier
      appVersion - application version (optional)
      Returns:
      device token response with registration details

    • unregisterDevice

      Parameters:
      userId - user identifier
      deviceId - device identifier to unregister

    • sendEmail

      public NotificationResponse sendEmail(String email, String subject, String templateId, Map<String,Object> variables)
      Sends a basic email notification (uses default email account). For automatic routing based on email type, use specific methods like sendMarketingEmail, sendSupportEmail, etc.
      Parameters:
      email - recipient email address
      subject - email subject
      templateId - template identifier
      variables - template variables
      Returns:
      notification response with ID and status

    • sendEmail

      Sends an email notification with priority.
      Parameters:
      email - recipient email address
      subject - email subject
      templateId - template identifier
      variables - template variables
      priority - notification priority (HIGH, NORMAL, LOW, URGENT)
      Returns:
      notification response with ID and status

    • sendPush

      @Deprecated(since="1.1.0", forRemoval=false) public NotificationResponse sendPush(String deviceToken, String title, String body, String templateId, Map<String,Object> variables)
      Deprecated.
      Use sendPushToUser(String, String, String, String, Map) instead
      Sends a push notification directly to a specific device token. Note: It's recommended to use sendPushToUser() instead, which handles all user devices.
      Parameters:
      deviceToken - device token
      title - notification title
      body - notification body
      templateId - template identifier
      variables - template variables
      Returns:
      notification response with ID and status

    • sendPush

      @Deprecated(since="1.1.0", forRemoval=false) public NotificationResponse sendPush(String deviceToken, String title, String body, String templateId, Map<String,Object> variables, String imageUrl, Map<String,String> data)
      Deprecated.
      Use sendPushToUser(String, String, String, String, Map, String, Map, String) instead
      Sends a push notification directly to a specific device token with custom data. Note: It's recommended to use sendPushToUser() instead, which handles all user devices.
      Parameters:
      deviceToken - device token
      title - notification title
      body - notification body
      templateId - template identifier
      variables - template variables
      imageUrl - optional image URL
      data - optional custom data
      Returns:
      notification response with ID and status

      Returns:
      notification response with ID and status

      Parameters:
      requests - list of notification requests
      Returns:
      bulk response with batch ID
